001package org.biopax.paxtools.controller;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
004import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXLevel;
005import org.biopax.paxtools.model.Model;
006import org.biopax.paxtools.util.IllegalBioPAXArgumentException;
007import org.slf4j.Logger;
008import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
009
010import java.util.*;
011
012/**
013 * This class is a composite property accessor that allows users to chain multiple
014 * property accessors to define paths in the BioPAX object graph.
015 * 
016 * The path can be defined by either explicitly providing a set of property accessors or
017 * by an xPath like syntax.
018 * 
019 * The path can contain transitive and or restricted sub paths:
020 * A transitive sub-path is traversed recursively as many times as possible. e.g. Complex/component* will
021 * return all components of the complex and the components of the components if those components
022 * are complex recursively.
023 * 
024 * A restricted subpath is restricted with a class and only follows through the domains that are
025 * assignable from the the restriction class. e.g. Control/controlled:Pathway/name will only return the
026 * names of the pathways that are being controlled, but not interactions.
027 */
028public class PathAccessor extends PropertyAccessorAdapter<BioPAXElement, Object>
029{
030
031        List<PropertyAccessor<? extends BioPAXElement, ?>> accessors;
032
033        Class<? extends BioPAXElement> domain;
034
035        List<Class<? extends BioPAXElement>> domainOrder = new ArrayList<Class<? extends BioPAXElement>>();
036
037        public static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(PathAccessor.class);
038
039        BioPAXLevel level;
040
041        /**
042         * Constructor for defining the access path with a list of accessors. All of the accessors must be of the same
043         * level. In the case one accessor's range can not be assigned by the domain of the next( broken path),
044         * this accessor will return an empty set.
045         * @param objectAccessors A list of object accessors.
046         * @param level biopax level
047         */
048        public PathAccessor(List<PropertyAccessor<? extends BioPAXElement, ?>> objectAccessors, BioPAXLevel level)
049        {
050                super(BioPAXElement.class, Object.class, true);
051                this.accessors = objectAccessors;
052                this.domain = objectAccessors.get(0).getDomain();
053                this.level = level;
054        }
055
056
057        /**
058         * Constructor for defining the access path via a XPath like string.
059         * @param path The string defining the path. The following operators can be used:
060         * <ul>
061         * <li>The first token is the class name of the starting domain.</li>
062         * <li>The next tokens are names of the properties, separated by "/"</li>
063         * <li>A property step can be restricted to a domain by defining the restriction class with ":" after the
064         * property </li>
065         * <li>A property step can be declared transitive by adding a "*" at the end. </li>
066         * <li>Two accessors can be joined by "|" (Currently not implemented)</li>
067         * <li>A subpath can be defined by a substring enclosed in "(" ")"</li>
068         * <li>Subpaths can also be restricted or made transitive</li>
069         * </ul>
070         * @param level BioPAX level that this path is defined in.
071         */
072        public PathAccessor(String path, BioPAXLevel level)
073        {
074                super(BioPAXElement.class, Object.class, true);
075                this.level = level;
076                parsePath(path, 0);
077        }
078
079        private PathAccessor(StringTokenizer tk, BioPAXLevel level, Class<? extends BioPAXElement> domain, int depth)
080        {
081                super(BioPAXElement.class, Object.class, true);
082                this.domain = domain;
083                this.level = level;
084                if (iterateTheRemainingPath(depth, tk) != depth)
085                        throw new IllegalBioPAXArgumentException("Unexpected element. Parentheses do not match!");
086        }
087
088        private int parsePath(String path, int depth)
089        {
090                StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(path, "/:*|()", true);
091                domain = getClass(st.nextToken());
092                this.accessors = new ArrayList<PropertyAccessor<? extends BioPAXElement, ?>>();
093                if (st.nextToken().equals("/"))
094                {
095                        PropertyAccessor stepAccessor = getStepAccessor(level, st, domain);
096
097                        // If the domain is more specific than the domain of the property accessor, then we need to filter it.
098                        if (!domain.equals(stepAccessor.getDomain()))
099                        {
100                                assert stepAccessor.getDomain().isAssignableFrom(domain) :
101                                        "There must be a serous bug in the design of property editor map!";
102
103                                stepAccessor = FilteredByDomainPropertyAccessor.create(stepAccessor, domain);
104                        }
105
106                        accessors.add(stepAccessor);
107                        domainOrder.add(domain);
108                } else throw new IllegalArgumentException();
109                return iterateTheRemainingPath(depth, st);
110        }
111
112        private int iterateTheRemainingPath(int depth, StringTokenizer st)
113        {
114                Class<? extends BioPAXElement> intermediate = getNextDomain();
115                while (st.hasMoreTokens())
116                {
117                        String s = st.nextToken();
118                        if (s.equals("("))
119                        {
120                                PathAccessor subPath = new PathAccessor(st, level, intermediate, depth++);
121                                accessors.add(subPath);
122                                domainOrder.add(intermediate);
123                                intermediate = getNextDomain();
124                        } else if (s.equals(")"))
125                        {
126                                return depth;
127                        } else if (s.equals("/"))
128                        {
129                                accessors.add(getStepAccessor(level, st, intermediate));
130                                domainOrder.add(intermediate);
131                                intermediate = getNextDomain();
132
133                        } else if (s.equals("*"))
134                        {
135                                PropertyAccessor lastAccessor =
136                                                accessors.remove(accessors.size() - 1);
137                                accessors.add(TransitivePropertyAccessor.create(lastAccessor));
138
139                        } else if (s.equals(":"))
140                        {
141                                Class<? extends BioPAXElement> restricted = getClass(st.nextToken());
142                                if (restricted != null)
143                                {
144                                        PropertyAccessor<? extends BioPAXElement, ?> lastAccessor = accessors.remove(accessors.size() - 1);
145                                        accessors.add(FilteredPropertyAccessor.create(lastAccessor, restricted));
146                                }
147                                intermediate = restricted;
148                        } else if (s.equals("|"))
149                        {
150                                throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented yet");
151                        } else throw new IllegalArgumentException();
152
153                }
154                return depth;
155        }
156
157        private Class<? extends BioPAXElement> getNextDomain()
158        {
159                return accessors.isEmpty() ? domain : getLastAccessor();
160        }
161
162        private Class<? extends BioPAXElement> getLastAccessor()
163        {
164                return (Class<? extends BioPAXElement>) accessors.get(accessors.size() - 1).getRange();
165        }
166
167        /**
168         * This constructor defaults to BioPAX Level 3.
169         * @param path The string defining the path. The following operators can be used:
170         * <ul>
171         * <li>The first token is the class name of the starting domain.</li>
172         * <li>The next tokens are names of the properties, separated by "/"</li>
173         * <li>A property step can be restricted to a domain by defining the restriction class with ":" after the
174         * property </li>
175         * <li>A property step can be declared transitive by adding a "*" at the end. </li>
176         * <li>Two accessors can be joined by "|" (Currently not implemented)</li>
177         * <li>A subpath can be defined by a substring enclosed in "(" ")"</li>
178         * <li>Subpaths can also be restricted or made transitive</li>
179         * </ul>
180         */
181        public PathAccessor(String path)
182        {
183                this(path, BioPAXLevel.L3);
184        }
185
186        private Class<? extends BioPAXElement> getClass(String domainstr)
187        {
188                Class<? extends BioPAXElement> domain = level.getInterfaceForName(domainstr);
189
190                if (domain == null) throw new IllegalBioPAXArgumentException(
191                                "Could not parse path." + domainstr + " did not resolve to any" + "BioPAX classes in level " + level +
192                                ".");
193
194                return domain;
195        }
196
197        public Set getValueFromBean(BioPAXElement bean) throws IllegalBioPAXArgumentException
198        {
199                Set<BioPAXElement> bpes = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
200                bpes.add(bean);
201                return getValueFromBeans(bpes);
202        }
203
204        @Override
205        public Set getValueFromBeans(Collection<? extends BioPAXElement> beans) throws IllegalBioPAXArgumentException
206        {
207                Collection<? extends BioPAXElement> bpes = beans;
208                for (int i = 0; i < accessors.size() - 1; i++)
209                {
210                        PropertyAccessor accessor = accessors.get(i);
211                        if (log.isTraceEnabled()) log.trace(String.valueOf(accessor));
212                        HashSet<BioPAXElement> nextBpes = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>();
213                        for (BioPAXElement bpe : bpes)
214                        {
215                                if (log.isTraceEnabled()) log.trace("\t" + bpe);
216                                Set valueFromBean = accessor.getValueFromBean(bpe);
217                                if (!valueFromBean.isEmpty())
218                                {
219                                        if (log.isTraceEnabled()) log.trace("\t\tv:" + valueFromBean);
220                                        nextBpes.addAll(valueFromBean);
221                                        if (log.isTraceEnabled()) log.trace("\t\tn:" + nextBpes);
222                                }
223                        }
224                        bpes = nextBpes;
225                }
226                HashSet values = new HashSet();
227                PropertyAccessor lastStep = accessors.get(accessors.size() - 1);
228                Class<? extends BioPAXElement> lastDomain = domainOrder.get(domainOrder.size() - 1);
229                if(log.isTraceEnabled()) log.trace(String.valueOf(lastStep));
230                for (BioPAXElement bpe : bpes)
231                {
232                        if (!lastDomain.isInstance(bpe)) continue;
233
234                        log.trace("\t" + bpe);
235                        Set valueFromBean = lastStep.getValueFromBean(bpe);
236                        if (!valueFromBean.isEmpty())
237                        {
238                                values.addAll(valueFromBean);
239                                log.trace("\t" + values);
240                        }
241                }
242                return values;
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * This method runs the path query on all the elements within the model.
247         * @param model to be queried
248         * @return a merged set of all values that is reachable by the paths starting from all applicable objects in
249         * the model. For example running ProteinReference/xref:UnificationXref on the model will get all the
250         * unification xrefs of all ProteinReferences.
251         */
252        public Set getValueFromModel(Model model)
253        {
254                Set<? extends BioPAXElement> domains = new HashSet<BioPAXElement>(model.getObjects(this.getDomain()));
255                return getValueFromBeans(domains);
256        }
257
258        private <D extends BioPAXElement> PropertyAccessor getStepAccessor(BioPAXLevel level, StringTokenizer ct,
259                        Class<D> domain)
260        {
261                String property = ct.nextToken();
262                PropertyAccessor simple = null;
263                if (property.endsWith("Of"))
264                {
265                        String forwardName = property.substring(0, property.length() - 2);
266                        Set<ObjectPropertyEditor> iEds = SimpleEditorMap.get(level).getInverseEditorsOf(domain);
267                        if (iEds == null)
268                        {
269                                throw new IllegalBioPAXArgumentException("No inverse editors defined for " + domain);
270                        }
271                        for (ObjectPropertyEditor ope : iEds)
272                        {
273                                if (ope.property.equals(forwardName))
274                                {
275                                        if (simple == null) simple = ope.getInverseAccessor();//TODO why not simply break, after assignment, instead using 'if'?
276                                }
277
278                        }
279                } else
280                {
281                        simple = SimpleEditorMap.get(level).getEditorForProperty(property, domain);
282                        if (simple == null)
283                        {
284                                Set<PropertyEditor<? extends D, ?>> subclassEditorsForProperty =
285                                                SimpleEditorMap.get(level).getSubclassEditorsForProperty(property, domain);
286                                simple = new UnionPropertyAccessor(subclassEditorsForProperty, domain);
287
288                        }
289                }
290                return simple;
291        }
292
293        @Override public boolean isUnknown(Object value)
294        {
295                if (value instanceof Set)
296                {
297                        for (Object o : (Set) value)
298                        {
299                                if (!isSingleUnknown(o))
300                                {
301                                        return false; // found a "known" value
302                                }
303                        }
304                        // empty set or all unknown
305                        return true;
306                } else
307                {
308                        return isSingleUnknown(value);
309                }
310        }
311
312        private boolean isSingleUnknown(Object value)
313        {
314                return value == null || BioPAXElement.UNKNOWN_DOUBLE.equals(value) ||
315                       BioPAXElement.UNKNOWN_FLOAT.equals(value) || BioPAXElement.UNKNOWN_INT.equals(value);
316        }
317
318        /**
319         * @param bpe BioPAXElement to be checked.
320         * @return true if bpe is an instance of the domain of this accessor.
321         */
322        public boolean applies(BioPAXElement bpe)
323        {
324                Class domain = accessors.iterator().next().getDomain();
325                return domain.isInstance(bpe);
326        }
327
328}
